etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Popular Science Monthly. From scientific Latin Zoochlorella, former genus name from zoo- + chlor- + classical Latin -ella

definitions: Any of various unicellular green algae (formerly grouped in the genus Zoochlorella) which are symbionts within the cells of certain freshwater and marine invertebrates and protists. Chiefly in plural.

notes.text: Zoochlorellae are now placed in multiple genera, especially the genus Chlorella.
